sites.name: Place Grenette
sites.description: The magnificent main square of Grenoble, a vibrant hub surrounded by historic buildings, cafes, and shops. This elegant square is the heart of the city and a perfect starting point for exploring Grenoble's rich heritage and Alpine culture.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful year-round, but spring and autumn offer pleasant temperatures for walking. Summer can be warm, winter can be cold with occasional snow.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Best visited early morning to avoid crowds and enjoy the peaceful atmosphere.

sites.name: Palais de Justice
sites.description: The magnificent Palace of Justice, a stunning building showcasing Grenoble's architectural heritage. This impressive structure represents the city's legal and administrative importance and offers beautiful views of the surrounding area.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. The building is perfect for rainy days. The architecture is spectacular in any weather.
sites.booking_tips: Free entry to the building grounds. Guided tours may be available. Respect that this is an active courthouse.

sites.name: Cathédrale Notre-Dame
sites.description: A stunning Gothic cathedral with beautiful stained glass windows and intricate stone carvings. The cathedral features impressive architecture and is one of Grenoble's most important religious and architectural landmarks.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. The stained glass creates beautiful light effects. Respectful dress required.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Guided tours available. Don't miss the beautiful interior and stained glass.

sites.name: Musée de Grenoble
sites.description: One of France's most important art museums, featuring an exceptional collection of modern and contemporary art. The museum's highlight is its impressive collection of 20th-century masterpieces and temporary exhibitions.
sites.seasonal_notes: Perfect for rainy days or any weather. Air-conditioned and comfortable year-round.
sites.booking_tips: Entry fee required. Book online in advance during peak season. Guided tours available. Allow 2-3 hours for the full experience.

sites.name: Église Saint-André
sites.description: A magnificent church known for its unique architecture and beautiful interior. The church features impressive stained glass windows and is one of Grenoble's most recognizable landmarks, representing the city's religious heritage.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. The architecture is particularly impressive in good light. Beautiful stained glass effects.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Guided tours available. Don't miss the beautiful interior and architecture.

sites.name: Vieille Ville (Old Town)
sites.description: The medieval heart of Grenoble featuring narrow cobblestone streets, historic buildings, hidden courtyards, and distinctive Alpine architecture. The area is particularly atmospheric in the evening when the historic buildings take on a magical quality.
sites.seasonal_notes: Year-round attraction. Spring and autumn offer pleasant walking weather. Summer evenings are magical.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Wear comfortable shoes for cobblestone streets. Guided walking tours available.

sites.name: Les Halles Sainte-Claire
sites.description: A vibrant covered market where locals shop for fresh produce, cheese, wine, and regional Alpine specialties. The market offers authentic local experience with traditional French products and foods.
sites.seasonal_notes: Busiest in the morning. Year-round activity. Covered market provides shelter from weather.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Respectful photography. Try local French foods and interact with vendors.

sites.name: Rue de la République
sites.description: One of Grenoble's most beautiful historic streets, lined with elegant buildings, boutique shops, and traditional restaurants. The street showcases French architecture and is perfect for shopping, dining, and admiring the city's architectural heritage.
sites.seasonal_notes: Most lively in the afternoon and weekends. Summer offers outdoor dining, winter has cozy indoor venues.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for most venues. Popular restaurants may require reservations on weekends.

sites.name: Téléphérique de la Bastille
sites.description: A historic cable car that takes visitors to the Bastille fortress, offering spectacular panoramic views of Grenoble and the surrounding Alps. The cable car is one of the city's most iconic attractions and provides access to hiking trails.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best visited in good weather. Spring and autumn offer pleasant temperatures and clear views of the Alps.
sites.booking_tips: Small fee required. Book in advance during peak season. Combine with a visit to the Bastille fortress.

sites.name: Jardin de Ville
sites.description: A beautiful urban park featuring walking trails, flower gardens, playgrounds, and historic monuments. Popular with locals for recreation and relaxation. Offers a peaceful escape from the city center with views of the surrounding Alps.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful in all seasons. Spring brings blooming flowers, summer offers shade, autumn has colorful foliage.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Bring water and comfortable walking shoes. Popular spot for picnics and outdoor activities.

sites.name: Porte de la Graille
sites.description: A historic gate that once formed part of Grenoble's medieval fortifications. While mostly in ruins, it's an important historical site and offers insight into Grenoble's medieval past. The surrounding area has been developed with restaurants and cafes.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best visited in good weather. Spring and autumn offer pleasant temperatures for exploring the ruins.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Combine with a meal at one of the nearby restaurants. Limited historical information on site.

sites.name: Musée de l'Ancien Évêché
sites.description: A fascinating museum showcasing Grenoble's history and culture, housed in a beautiful historic building. Features exhibits on local history, archaeology, and the region's rich cultural heritage.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Air-conditioned for comfortable visits in any weather. Perfect for understanding local culture.
sites.booking_tips: Free entry. Guided tours available. Allow 1.5-2 hours for the full experience.

sites.name: Hôtel de Ville
sites.description: The city hall of Grenoble, housed in a beautiful historic building with distinctive architecture. While not open to the public, the building is worth seeing for its architectural interest and the surrounding area is a popular gathering spot.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best viewed in good weather. The building looks impressive at night when illuminated.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required to view from outside. Consider attending public events held in the plaza.

sites.name: Parc Paul Mistral
sites.description: A scenic park located in the heart of Grenoble offering beautiful gardens, walking trails, and peaceful atmosphere. Features walking trails, viewpoints, and is popular with families and nature lovers. Perfect for photography and relaxation.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best visited in good weather. Spring and autumn offer the most pleasant conditions. Summer can be warm.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Bring water and comfortable walking shoes. Perfect for nature photography.

sites.name: MC2
sites.description: A prestigious cultural venue hosting theatre, dance, and contemporary performances. The building itself is architecturally significant and represents Grenoble's commitment to contemporary culture. Check the schedule for performances during your visit.
sites.seasonal_notes: Performance season runs year-round. Book tickets in advance for popular performances.
sites.booking_tips: Book tickets online or at the box office. Dress appropriately for performances. Guided tours of the building available.

sites.name: Maison de l'International
sites.description: A beautiful building known for its distinctive architecture and cultural significance. This architectural gem showcases Grenoble's international connections and is one of the city's most photographed buildings.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best viewed in good weather. The building looks impressive at night when illuminated.
sites.booking_tips: View from outside. The building may offer cultural events. Perfect for photography.

sites.name: Marché de l'Estacade
sites.description: A traditional market where locals and visitors can sample and purchase French products. Offers authentic local experience and opportunities to taste traditional French foods and learn about the region's culinary culture.
sites.seasonal_notes: Busiest in the morning. Year-round activity. Covered market provides shelter from weather.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Respectful photography. Try local French foods and interact with vendors.

sites.name: Université Grenoble Alpes
sites.description: A prestigious university with a beautiful campus featuring interesting architecture and green spaces. The campus is a center of student life and the surrounding area has many student-friendly cafes and bookstores.
sites.seasonal_notes: Campus is most lively during the academic year. Summer is quieter but still worth visiting.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Respect that this is an active educational institution. Campus tours may be available.

sites.name: Bibliothèque d'Étude et du Patrimoine
sites.description: A heritage library housed in a beautiful historic building with interesting architecture. While primarily a research facility, the building is worth seeing and the surrounding area is pleasant for walking.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best viewed in good weather. The building looks impressive at night when illuminated.
sites.booking_tips: View from outside unless you have research needs. The surrounding area is good for photography.

sites.name: Jardin des Dauphins
sites.description: A peaceful botanical garden featuring native Alpine plants and trees. Offers walking paths, benches for relaxation, and educational displays about local flora. A perfect escape from the city's hustle and bustle.
sites.seasonal_notes: Most beautiful in spring when flowers are blooming. Summer offers shade, autumn has colorful foliage.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Bring water and comfortable walking shoes. Perfect for nature photography.
